Vain and territorial, blue dragons soar through the skies over deserts, preying on caravans and plundering herds and settlements in the verdant lands beyond the desert's reach. These dragons can also be found in dry steppes, searing badlands, and rocky coasts. They guard their territories against all potential competitors, especially brass dragons.

A blue dragon is recognized by its dramatic frilled ears and the massive ridged horn atop its blunt head. Rows of spikes extend back from its nostrils to line its brow, and cluster on its jutting lower jaw.

A blue dragon's scales vary in color from an iridescent azure to a deep indigo, polished to a glossy finish by the desert sands. As the dragon ages, its scales become thicker and harder, and its hide hums and crackles with static electricity. These effects intensify when the dragon is angry or about to attack, giving off an odor of ozone and dusty air.

entries.name: Vain and Deadly
entries: A blue dragon will not stand for any remark or insinuation that it is weak or inferior, taking great pleasure in lording its power over humanoids and other lesser creatures.

A blue dragon is a patient and methodical combatant. When fighting on its own terms, it turns combat into an extended affair of hours or even days, attacking from a distance with volleys of lightning, then flying well out of harm's reach as it waits to attack again.

entries.name: Desert Predators
entries: Though they sometimes eat cacti and other desert plants to sate their great hunger, blue dragons are carnivores. They prefer to dine on herd animals, cooking those creatures with their lightning breath before gorging themselves. Their dining habits make blue dragons an enormous threat to desert caravans and nomadic tribes, which become convenient collections of food and treasure to a dragon's eye.

When it hunts, a blue dragon buries itself in the desert sand so that only the horn on its nose pokes above the surface, appearing to be an outcropping of stone. When prey draws near, the dragon rises up, sand pouring from its wings like an avalanche as it attacks.

entries.name: Overlords and Minions
entries: Blue dragons covet valuable and talented creatures whose service reinforces their sense of superiority. Bards, sages, artists, wizards, and assassins can become valuable agents for a blue dragon, which rewards loyal service handsomely.

A blue dragon keeps its lair secret and well protected, and even its most trusted servants are rarely allowed within. It encourages ankhegs, giant scorpions, and other creatures of the desert to dwell near its lair for additional security. Older blue dragons sometimes attract air elementals and other creatures to serve them.

entries.name: Hoarders of Gems
entries: Though blue dragons collect anything that looks valuable, they are especially fond of gems. Considering blue to be the most noble and beautiful of colors, they covet sapphires, favoring jewelery and magic items adorned with those gems.
A blue dragon buries its most valuable treasures deep in the sand, while scattering a few less valuable trinkets in plainer sight over hidden sinkholes to punish and eliminate would-be thieves.

entries.name: A Blue Dragon's Lair
entries: Blue dragons make their lairs in barren places, using their lightning breath and their burrowing ability to carve out crystallized caverns and tunnels beneath the sands.

Thunderstorms rage around a legendary blue dragon's lair, and narrow tubes lined with glassy sand ventilate the lair, all the while avoiding the deadly sinkholes that are the dragon's first line of defense.

A blue dragon will collapse the caverns that make up its lair if that lair is invaded. The dragon then burrows out, leaving its attackers to be crushed and suffocated. When it returns later, it collects its possessions-along with the wealth of the dead intruders.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.
Dragon Age Categories

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Part of the ceiling collapses above one creature that the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} and buried. The buried target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature can take an action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check, ending the buried state on a success.

A cloud of sand swirls about in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The cloud spreads around corners. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Lightning arcs, forming a 5-foot-wide line between two of the lair's solid surfaces that the dragon can see. They must be within 120 feet of the dragon and 120 feet of each other. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage.

entries.name: Additional Lair Actions
entries: At your discretion, a legendary ({@creature Adult Blue Dragon||adult} or {@creature Ancient Blue Dragon||ancient}) blue dragon can use one or both of the following additional lair actions while in its lair:

items.name: Misleading Mirage
items.entry: Until initiative count 20 on the next round, at each intersection or branching passage in the lair, a creature other than the dragon has a {@chance 50|50 percent} chance of going in a different direction from the direction it intends.

items.name: Sudden Sinkhole
items.entry: The dragon chooses a point on the ground that it can see within 120 feet of it. A 5-foot-radius, 20-foot-deep pit forms centered on that point. A creature on the ground above where the pit formed must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature falls to the bottom of the pit, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and landing {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature moves to the nearest unoccupied space instead of falling in the pit.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a legendary blue dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Thunderstorms rage within 6 miles of the lair.
Dust devils scour the land within 6 miles of the lair. A dust devil has the statistics of an air elemental, but it can't fly, has a speed of 50 feet, and has an Intelligence and Charisma of 1 (-5).

Hidden sinkholes form in and around the dragon's lair. A sinkhole can be spotted from a safe distance with a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. Otherwise, the first creature to step on the thin crust covering the sinkhole must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@dice 1d6 × 10} feet into the sinkhole.

entries: If the dragon dies, the dust devils disappear immediately, and the thunderstorms abate within {@dice 1d10} days. Any sinkholes remain where they are.

entries.name: Additional Regional Effects
entries: Any of these effects might appear in the area around a blue dragon's lair, in addition to or instead of the effects described in the {@i Monster Manual}:

items.name: Blue Luster
items.entry: Creatures that spend a year within 1 mile of the dragon's lair find blue objects fascinating and feel compelled to acquire them at every opportunity.

items.name: Mirage Terrain
items.entry: The area immediately surrounding the lair appears to be a lush oasis. A creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to disbelieve it. A creature who disbelieves the illusion sees it as a vague image superimposed on the underlying terrain.

items.name: Sandstorm
items.entry: A sandstorm blows constantly within 1 mile of the dragon's lair.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Plasmaris uses Charisma as her spellcasting modifier {@dc 20} {@hit 12}

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wendigo's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The wendigo can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wendigo has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wendigo regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wendigo takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wendigo's next turn. The wendigo dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Wendigo fails a save it can choose to succeed instead

trait.name: Baleful Howl
entries: The wendigo emits a terrifying howl. Every enemy within 300 feet of the wendigo that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the wendigo must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the wendigo as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wendigo uses its Baleful Howl and makes three melee attacks: one with its ravenous bite or gore and two with its claws.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

If the wendigo moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ravenous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured.

While {@condition poisoned}, the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} at the start of each of its turns. This reduction will not cause a target's score to go below 3. When a target's Wisdom reaches a score of 3, it becomes insane and ravenous. While in this state, the creature acts as an ally of the wendigo, gains a bite attack ({@damage 1d6} piercing damage), and must spend its action each turn making a bite attack against an enemy of the wendigo. The Wisdom score reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest, unless the target has become ravenous in that case it becomes a Tikbalang if not Remove Cursed in 24 hours. If not cured in 7 days by Geater Restoration the target becomes a Wendigo

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Uses its claw attack twice against the same target.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Uses its bite attack

legendary.name: Nimble Movement
entries: Moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks

legendary.name: Charge (2 Actions)
entries: Moves up to its movement speed and makes a gore attack.

bonus.name: Maddening Whispers
entries: As a bonus action, the wendigo chooses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the wendigo's choice that the wendigo can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death knight is a 19th-level spell caster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the death knight must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the death knight by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the death knight, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the death knight's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

trait.name: Smite (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action, when the death knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a 1st level spell slot to deal {@damage 2d8} radiant or necrotic damage to the target. If the death knight expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When you use the Dash action, difficult terrain doesn't cost you extra movement on that turn. Additionally, when you make a melee attack against a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.

trait.name: Strong Mind
entries: Advantage on Constitution Saves to maintain {@status concentration} on a spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Chooses to succeed on a saving throw it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight uses Command Undead. It then makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage regaining half as much necrotic damage in hit points.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage regaining half as much necrotic damage in hit points. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage and 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Command
entries: The death knight uses its Command Undead ability.

legendary.name: Deft Strike
entries: The death knight makes a weapon attack and moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The death knight casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

bonus.name: Command Undead
entries: The death knight targets one undead ally it can see within 30 feet of it and gives it a telepathic command. The target can use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack.

monster.name: Echo of Atriaxx

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) force damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spell
entries: Casts a Ki spell

actionHeader: Atriaxx can Cast a Ki Spell or make 2 weapon attacks

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Casts these spells using Ki with a {@dc 18}

trait.name: Stunning Strike 4/Day
entries: A target hit by one of Atriaxx's attacks must make a {@dc 18} Constitution Save or be {@condition stunned} until the end of his next turn.

trait.name: Feats
entries: Mobile - no AOp
Crusher - push 5 once, adv after crits
Athlete - Stand up is 5
Sentinel - No Disengage allowed, AOp stops move

bonus.name: Monk Shit
entries: Atriaxx can make one attack with his Sword, or 2 with his Fist if he uses his Action to make weapon attacks

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the archmage fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Supreme Focus
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws it makes to maintain its {@status concentration}.

trait.name: Strength of the Grave
entries: When damage reduces Zephara to 0 hit points, you can make a Charisma saving throw ({@dc 5} + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. If she is reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage or by a critical hit, this trait doesn't function.

trait.name: Portent
entries: Roll {@dice 3d20} and record those rolls, Zephara replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by her or a creature that she can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage. If the target is a Large of smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Green Flame Blade
entries: quarterstaff damage + {@damage 3d8} fire, and {@damage 3d8+5} fire to a target within 5ft of the other.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage casts one of the following spells using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks):
footerEntries: *Contingency for being targeted by an attack

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The archmage casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The archmage uses its Teleport action.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The archmage casts a spell.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: The archmage magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying and any creatures it has {@condition grappled}, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monster.name: Ghaffari Hit Squad

trait.name: Banneret
entries: When you use your Second Wind feature, you can choose up to three creatures within 60 feet of you that are allied with you. Each one regains hit points equal to your fighter level, provided that the creature can see or hear you.

When you use your Action Surge feature, you can choose one creature within 60 feet of you that is allied with you. That creature can make one melee or ranged weapon attack with its reaction, provided that it can see or hear you.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the Ghaffari Hit Squad can regain hit points equal to {@damage 1d10 + 10}

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Ghaffari Hit Squad can take an extra action on its turn.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage.

action.name: Carbine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 100/100 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) damage.

action.name: Sharpshot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/100 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 1d10 + 14}) damage.

actionHeader: The Hit Squad member makes two attacks

bonus.name: Dual Wield
entries: If the hit squad member attacks with a scimitar using its action make a single scimitar attack as a Bonus Action

trait.name: Feats
entries: Crusher
Athlete

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, The Don can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Family Rings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) b/p/s damage or {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) b/p/s damage.

action.name: Revolver
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) piercing damage, target cannot regain HP until start of his next turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Moves his speed

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Makes an attack

bonus.name: Extra Strike
entries: If The Don attacks with only his fists he can make a attack as his bonus actions with the Rings

item.name: Cloak of Cleanliness
entries: While wearing this cloak, you are always pristinely clean and well kept, along with having a slight scent of lavender.

item.name: Infinite Grimoire
entries: Your spell book now has an infinite number of pages, is three inches thick, eight inches wide, twelve inches long, and weighs three pounds.

You can use the grimoire as your spellbook, and you can scribe new spells into it as normal. When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire, the number of wizard spells you can prepare increases by 1.
In the presence of Wizards that show great power, those Wizards may see the grimoire show increased abilities over time.

entries.name: Perfected
entries: These features require attunement to the Infinite Grimoire:
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 3 additional level of spells.
When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire as your spellbook, the number of spells you can prepare increases by 3 total.
If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
You gain a +2 to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC for your wizard spells.

item.name: Thunder of the Mammoth
entries: When blowing into this horn one creature of your choice can hear a Mammoth bellow, provided the creature is within 600 feet of the horn and not {@condition deafened}. No other creature hears sound coming from the horn.
As an Action you can use the command phrase and blow the horn to create a booming sound and cast the spell Shatter from it [DC13 CON]. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Life Stealing
entries: While wearing this amulet you can use an action to make an unarmed strike using STR or DEX to make the attack roll dealing {@dice 1d4} slashing{@damage  + 4d4} necrotic damage on a hit. Any necrotic damage is transferred to you as healing. Once used this property can't be used again until Midnight.
\columnbreak

item.name: Bracers of the War Mage
item.reqAttune: by a warlock, wizard, or sorcerer
entries: These bracers are made of hardened Dwarven Steel and are imbued with strong defensive magic, to protect the Dwarven War Mages in battle. While wearing these bracers your AC is 14 + DEX.

entries.name: Merchants Luck
entries: When worn (no attunement) the wearer gains advantage on the first persuasion check made every day used in relation to a trade (sale, purchase or barter).

entries.name: Tricksters Pain
entries: When worn (and attuned) the wearer cannot be deceived without being aware of the attempted deceit. The wearer cannot read minds but will immediately know when someone is not being completely truthful and have insight into the degree/scope of the subterfuge in question

entries.name: Spirit Bound
entries: When worn (and attuned) the wearers spirit/soul is bound to the diamond and becomes absorbed by the diamond upon death. When absorbed the spirit remains in the diamond until released. The soul is released when the necklace is worn by another creature and the soul determines that the creature is a suitable host and the soul will then take over the host body and imbue it with all its powers, traits and skills.

item.name: Dwarven Maul of Thunder
entries: This hand sized maul is made of Dwarven Steel inscribed with thunder runes, it hums with a light buzz. It is a martial melee weapon with the light and thrown properties and a range of 30/60. The damage die is {@dice d6}+STR and the type is thunder, after a throw the hammer returns to the thrower's hand.

Once per day on your turn as an Action you can speak the command phrase (BY ODINS BEARD) and throw the hammer a a target or unoccupied space, if at a target make an attack roll, any creature within 20 feet of the impact must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} lightning and {@dice 4d6} thunder as lightning strikes the area and the hammer crashes with a thunderclap. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the hammer can still be used as a magic weapon.
\pagebreakNum

item.name: Psionic Amplifier
entries: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you are attuned to this item. It has no Effect if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.
It also grants you telepathy (120ft) and glows with a purplish inner light (15 bright/15 dim) while you are attuned to it.
See the introduction of the Monster Manual for rules on how this telepathy works.

entries.name: Winds of Truth
entries: These matching armbands appear to have thin daggers strapped to them. As an action, you can pull up to two magic +1 daggers from the bracers and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack as the dagger seeks out a target that you can see within 120 feet of you ignoring half and three-quarters cover. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

item.name: Wand of Winter Storms
entries: This wand has 7 charges and is made of translucent crystal resembling a slender icicle. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell ice storm} spell (save DC 17) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 4th-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand melts into water and is destroyed.

entries.name: Swiftness of Sand
entries: The wielder of this Heka, as an action speaks the command phrase "I hate sand. Its coarse, and rough, and irritating. And it gets everywhere." and is magically transformed into a whirlwind of sand, moving up to 60 feet, and reverting to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the wielder is immune to all damage, and it can't be {@condition grappled}, {@condition petrified}, knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned}. Equipment worn or carried by the wielder remain in its possession. Once used in such a way it is unable to be used until the next dawn.

item.name: The Devil's Due
entries: This arrow has a icy blue shaft adorned with chardalyn razor fletching and matching head.

entries.name: Levistus' Ire
entries: This arrow adds a {@dice d6} of cold damage along with giving an additional +1 to attack and damage rolls when used to make a ranged attack, returning upon reaching or missing its target. Hitting a target with this arrow makes your next shot against that target have advantage. Upon a critical hit the target is wounded and loses 10 feet of movement speed and 5 feet for each after the first.
\columnbreak

item.name: Amulet of Lathander
entries: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this holy symbol. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Sword of the Elements
entries: This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure energy to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} or {@item longsword|phb|longswords}, you are proficient with this sword.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals force damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an elemental with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage.

item.name: Spelljamming Mythallar
entries: The Spelljamming Mythallar looks like an large crystal ball filled with a swirling miasma resembling Wildspace held in an ornate cradle. The globe draws magic directly from the Weave that can be harnessed for various purposes. The Spelljamming Mythallar is capable of venturing into the multiverse.

The Spelljamming Mythallar is 10 feet in diameter, but controls the area within 500 feet of it. To attune to this mythallar, a creature must finish a short rest within 30 feet of it, meditating on the mythallar, this artifact does not count against your attunement limit. The Spelljamming Mythallar's properties are as follows:

items: While you're within 500 feet of the Spelljamming Mythallar, you can choose which direction and how fast the mythallar moves.  It can move up to Spelljamming Speed (100 million miles in 24 hours) in Wildspace or the Astral Sea, or up to 10 mph while objects weighing 1 ton or more are within 1 mile of it. All matter within 500 feet of the device moves with it. The Spelljamming Mythallar and all structures held aloft by it hover in place when not in motion. In Wildspace the Spelljamming Mythallar has enough air for 180 million days.

As an action, you can cause one magic item you are holding within 30 feet of the Spelljamming Mythallar to immediately regain all its expended charges or uses. A magic item recharged in this manner can't be recharged by the Spelljamming Mythallar again until after the item regains expended charges or uses on its own.

You can use the Spelljamming Mythallar to cast the {@spell dream of the blue veil|tce} provided you have the material components. The creature limit is lifted and instead uses the area controlled by the mythallar. The creatures also do not fall unconscious but the area controlled by the mythallar enters a transitive plane between origin and destination for the duration. This property can be used 1 time per week, or after the mythallar has been fueled by a magic item (up to DM Discretion).

Any creature that touches the globe of the mythallar must make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 30d10 + 100} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any object that touches the globe, other than some artifacts or the mythallar's cradle, is disintegrated instantly (no save).

entries.name: Transfer Attunement
entries: You can use an action to touch a willing spellcaster. That creature attunes to the Spelljamming Mythallar immediately, and your attunement to it ends.

item.name: Belt of Utility
entries: This canvas belt is adorned with many small pouches along the strap, it is able to magically fit any waist. When the wearer reaches into a pouch of this belt they are able to pull any Adventuring Gear of their choice worth less than 10gp as their item interaction. The item persists until the belt is used again or the item is not in use, then the item produced disappears.

item.name: Belt of Giant Might
entries: While attuned to this belt, your Strength score changes to 19. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 19.

You can channel the Ancient Giant's essence as a Bonus Action to gain the benefits of the Enlarge portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 minute. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Adventurer's Guide to Térûvia
entries: The Adventurer's Guide to Térûvia contains the basic knowledge an Adventurer would need to navigate Térûvia. In addition to information the book contains a map with live tracking of the book's location to aid in navigation, along with the forms needed for reports and the means to send them via transport slot on the back of the cover. This handbook, can't be damaged by fire, acid, or immersion in water. In addition, the book doesn't deteriorate with age.

item.name: Adventurers Initiative ID
entries: The Adventurers Initiative ID is keyed to each individual Adventurer and functions as your pass around Térûvia as it is used to reap any of the benefits that come with being and Adventurer like lodging, rations, ammunition, and basic components. It also functions as a coin purse for the keyed Adventurer storing all coin one might encounter and converting between Silver, Gold, and Platinum at will. The ID also lets the Adventurer know when the damage or effect they may be trying to inflict on a target is useful or not calling out Immunities and Resistances along with Vulnerabilities.

item.name: Wand of the Weavestepper
entries: This wand is made from many rare woods twisted and fused together using the raw power of the Weave by the Witch Neia Kelxisys, Vekzian Hero of the Great War. The wand was her chosen tool of destruction when facing off against the warring nations of Kol and Eshea allowing her to move among the battlefield with ease.

You have advantage on initiative rolls while you are holding the wand. In addition whenever you use a spell slot to cast a spell, you can immediately teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you.

item.name: All Terrain Vehicle
entries: This object appears as a wooden box engraved with R. S. H. on the top face, it measures 12 inches long, 6 inches wide, and 6 inches deep. It weighs 4 pounds and floats. This item also has four command words, each requiring you to use an action to speak it.
The first command word, 'Wheels', causes the box to unfold into a basic wagon.

The second command word, 'Stroke', causes the box to unfold into a boat 15 feet long, 8 feet wide, 2 feet deep, and with a speed of 2 mph. The boat has two pairs of oars, an anchor, a mast, and a lateen sail. The boat can hold up to eight Medium creatures comfortably.

The third command word, 'Sail', causes the box to take the shape of a ship 50 feet long, 20 feet wide; and 15 feet deep, and with a speed of 4 mph. The ship has a deck, a steering oar, an anchor, a deck cabin, and a mast with a sail. The ship can hold fifteen Medium creatures comfortably.
When the box becomes a vessel, its weight becomes that of a normal vessel its size, and anything that was stored in the box remains in the boat.
The fourth command word, 'Park' causes the folding boat to fold back into a box, provided that no creatures are aboard. Any objects in the vessel remain outside the box as it folds.

item.name: Salve of Swimming
entries: This jar contains enough salve for 6 uses when full. You can coat yourself in this greasy substance over the course of a minute and your skin magically repels water granting you the ability to move through water easily. When applied the potion grants you a swim speed of 40 feet for 1 hours but confers no other benefits.

item.name: Belt of the Tempest (Dormant)
entries: The Belt of the Tempest was found by Logen and the other Witchlight Warriors inside an ancient temple of Atlanta, it formed from a Divine Spark granted to him after proving his mettle. The Divine Spark took the form of a thick dark blue leather belt adorned with large metal plates covered in storm-based iconogrophy.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the Belt of the Tempest in its dormant state, you have resistance to lightning damage and thunder damage, and your Strength score is raised by 2 to a Maximum of 30. In addition, you can use a bonus action to become a Storm Avatar for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits for the duration:

items: You have immunity to lightning damage and thunder damage.

When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals bludgeoning damage, it deals thunder damage instead. When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals piercing or slashing damage, it deals lightning damage instead.

As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to be struck by lightning. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: Once you use the Belt of the Tempest's Storm Avatar property, that property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bloodwell Vial of Wealth (Dormant)
entries: The Bloodwell of Wealth was once a standard Bloodwell Vial but has been imbued with a Divine Spark, when Gerry DeMarkk and the Witchlight Warriors delved into a Temple of Rikkus to prove their worth.The Divine Spark changed the existing Bloobwell Vial that called to Gerry all those years ago in that shop, into a more extravagant version adorned with fine gems and the golden symbol of Rikkus etched into the glass vial. To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, in addition it has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
When you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.
You can cast use the vial to cast the following spells: {@spell cure wounds} *as a 2nd-level spell*, {@spell lesser restoration}, and {@spell shield of faith}.

entries: Once the vial has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Pike's Pike
entries: This magical quarterstaff is made of braided fibers from the Elemental Plane of Water. As a bonus action, you can speak the weapon's command word to cast {@spell shillelagh}, taking the form of a small Pike. While in this form it deals piercing instead of bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Kringle's Revenge
entries: Kringle's Revenge is a unique blade forged from the soul of Santa's mightiest warrior, Klaus. It has a platinum hilt and a blade made of candy cane patterned crystal.

Rudolf, after betraying his comrades to side with the Triad of grinch, kept and tortured Klaus in Santa's workshop until he grew tired of his screaming and hired a mage to trap his soul inside the sword so he could watch as Rudolf brought Christmas to an end all across the land. The sword, when attuned to, has the following properties.

items: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals cold damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit Rudolf with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} cold damage.

The sword's luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is christmas cheer. While the blade persists, you can use an action to expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Kringle's Revenge is a sentient chaotic good weapon with an Intelligence of 8, a Wisdom of 8, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and normal vision out to a range of 60 feet. The weapon communicates by telepathic speech to the creature carrying it or wielding it.

entries.name: Personality
entries: The Sunsword's special purpose is to destroy Rudolf, and bring back Christmas.

item.name: Joydrinker
entries: Joydrinker was given to Rudolf von Scrooge by the Grinches as repayment for helping them end Christmas. This sword, when attuned to, has the following properties.

items: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals cold damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit Rudolf with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.
The attuned wielder regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed to turn the attuned wearer into a Scrooge after 7 days, nothing short of {@spell wish|phb} can end attunement.

item.name: Holy Symbol of Christmas Spirit
item.reqAttune: by a cleric or paladin who wants to spread christmas cheer
entries: The Holy Symbol of Christmas Spirit is a unique holy symbol sacred to the good-hearted lovers of Christmas. It predates the establishment of Christmas itself and is rumored to have helped Santa himself spread his cheer. According to legend, it was delivered to a paladin named Kris Kringle by a giant reindeer, or an angel in the form of a giant reindeer.
The holy symbol is a platinum amulet shaped like a tree, with a large crystal embedded in its center.
The holy symbol has 10 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Hold Scrooge
entries: As an action, you can expend 1 charge and present the holy symbol to make it flare with holy power. Scrooges and their spawn within 30 feet of the holy symbol when it flares must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end the effect on itself.

entries.name: Christmas Cheer
entries: As an action, you can expend 5 charges while presenting the holy symbol to make it shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is Christmas Cheer and lasts for 10 minutes or until you end the effect (no action required).

item.name: Rings of the Trickster (Dormant)
entries: When Unamed and the Witchlight Warriors were tested by Haymil the spark given to Unamed took the form of two rings. These paired rings are engraved with small knives and other bladed weapons in an intricate pattern that conceals the true design to anyone but the attuned wearer.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: As part of the attunement to these rings you must choose weapons to bond with each, once bonded the weapon exists in an extra dimensional space inside the ring, is considered on your person, and can be drawn to your hand a flick of the wrist and are stored by you at will as long as they exist on the same plane. You also gain the following additonal benefits while attuned:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to your bonded melee weapon strikes damage and to hit.
You gain the Two-Weapon Fighting fighting style.

When you successfully use your sneak attack as part of your attack action, you can make a second sneak attack strike, with your offhand weapon as part of Two-Weapon Fighting, against another target using half the number of Sneak Attack dice for your level (round up).

item.name: Schrödinger's Potion
entries: This potion is of unknown effects as the properties are unable to be determined until observed.
The potion's effects are only able to be known once consumed, consult your DM for the effect.

item.name: Glamoured Gold
entries: This suit is made of golden stretchy material. You can also use a bonus action to cause the suit to assume the appearance of any clothing. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or remove the suit.

item.name: Mote of Knowledge (Dormant)
entries: A Spellshard of endless volume able to hold as much information as one can find, gifted to Jarzamel by Ceritas herself imbued with her Divine energy, given as a reward for the Witchlight Warriors answering her call.

A wizard can use this spellshard as a spellbook, with the usual cost in gold and time to scribe a spell into the shard. You can use an action to open your mind to the shard, seeing its content in your mind. On subsequent rounds, reading the text or scribing new text on blank pages in the shard requires concentration (as if concentrating on a spell) and takes the same amount of time it takes you to read and write normally. Thinking of a particular phrase or topic draws you to the first section in the shard that addresses it.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You can use the Mote as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it, in addition it has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
When you prepare wizard spells attuned to the mote the number of spells you can prepare increases by 1.
The Gold cost for Spell Copying is halved while using the Mote as your spellbook.

item.name: Markings of the Wild (Dormant)
entries: Upon the Witchlight Warriors proving their worth to Verdana she gifted Benax a Divine Spark that altered his existing tattoo, enhancing it further.This tattoo when placed in the skin and attuned covers the wearers limbs and body with intricate vine patterns along with the symbol of Verdana appearing on the forehead.

entries.name: Nature's Wrath
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute. For the duration:

items: Each of your melee attacks with a weapon or an unarmed strike can reach a target up to 15 feet away from you, as vines launch toward the target
Your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage on a hit.
Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: It has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

items: Your attacks with monk weapons and unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to non-magical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
Your Constitution Score is raised by 2 to a Maximum of 30.
As a bonus action you can regain Ki points equal to roll of your Martial Arts Die, once per long rest.

item.name: Raven's Eye
entries: This necklace is a gift from the Matron of Ravens, Markuul, it can be used to trap a soul and bind it to a Domain within the Shadowfell. As a reaction when a creature dies within 120 feet of you you can bind the soul to the necklace. However, if the attuned creature dies while wearing it your soul shall be bound instead. Upon a soul being bound the necklace vanishes and your attunement ends.

item.name: Ram of Silent Entry
entries: You can use the Ram of Silent Entry, like a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.The ram also has a button you can activate as an action to make your next strike against the door in silence, once this property is used it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Skyrider's Board
entries: The Skyrider's Board is a common tool among the Air Zashnik with each of their warriors needing to undergo a trip to the Plane of Air to retrieve the reagents, this one belonged to Gustav Breeze Chief of the Air Zashnik.

While you are mounted on the Skyrider's Board, you can use an action to cast the {@spell levitate} spell on yourself at will. If your concentration drops and you would fall, the board casts {@spell feather fall} on you.

item.name: Scholar's Knuckles
entries: This set of Knuckle Dusters are crafted from Divinium and inscribed with magical runes to allow a spellcaster to channel their magical ability into martial prowess. While attuned you are proficient with them, can use them as a spellcasting focus, and melee attacks you make with the Scholar's Knuckles are made with your spell attack modifier, and you add your spell ability modifier to damage rolls.

item.name: Potion of Warding
entries: This potion is a glowing blue syrup-like liquid. When consumed it surrounds you in a blue arcane shield and you gain resistance to damage until the beginning of your next turn.

item.name: Arclight Boomerang
entries: This boomerang is a ranged weapon made from arclight found in the Storm Queen's lair. When thrown, it has a range of 60/120 feet, and any creature that is proficient with the javelin is also proficient with this weapon. On a hit, the boomerang deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d4} lightning damage, and the lightning arcs to another target of your choice within 30 feet, who must make a DC 15 Dexterity Save or take the same lightning damage.
Once the boomerang deals lightning damage to a target, the weapon loses its ability to deal lightning damage and functions as a magical boomerang that returns after each attack until the next dawn.

item.name: Belt of the Tempest (Awakened)
entries: The Belt of the Tempest was found by Logen and the other Witchlight Warriors inside an ancient temple of Atlanta, it formed from a Divine Spark granted to him after proving his mettle. The Divine Spark took the form of a thick dark blue leather belt adorned with large metal plates covered in storm-based iconogrophy.

entries.name: Storm Avatar
entries: You can use a bonus action to become a Storm Avatar for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits for the duration:

items: You have immunity to lightning damage and thunder damage.

When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals bludgeoning damage, it deals thunder damage instead. When you hit with a weapon attack that normally deals piercing or slashing damage, it deals lightning damage instead.

As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to be struck by lightning. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you use the Belt of the Tempest's Storm Avatar property, that property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the Belt of the Tempest in its Dormant state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to lightning damage and thunder damage.
Your Strength score is raised by 2 to a Maximum of 30.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Growing in power and reaching its Awakened state the Belt of the Tempest grants these new properties:

items: While in Storm Avatar state gain a Flying Speed with hover, equal to your walking speed
Your Strength Score is now raised by 4 to a Maximum of 30.
You gain an additional Second Wind per short rest.

item.name: Bloodwell Vial of Wealth (Awakened)
entries: The Bloodwell of Wealth was once a standard Bloodwell Vial but has been imbued with a Divine Spark, when Gerry DeMarkk and the Witchlight Warriors delved into a Temple of Rikkus to prove their worth.The Divine Spark changed the existing Bloobwell Vial that called to Gerry all those years ago in that shop, into a more extravagant version adorned with fine gems and the golden symbol of Rikkus etched into the glass vial. To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, in addition it has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
When you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.
You can use the vial to cast the following spells; {@spell cure wounds} (as a 2nd-level spell), {@spell lesser restoration}, and {@spell shield of faith}.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Growing in power and reaching its Awakened state the Bloodwell Vial of Wealth grants these new properties:

items: You now gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and {@spell guidance} doesn't count against your known cantrip limit.
Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.
You can additionally cast {@spell protection from evil and good|phb}, {@spell augury|phb}, and {@spell speak with dead|phb} with the vial.

entries: Once the vial has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Rings of the Trickster (Awakened)
entries: When Unamed and the Witchlight Warriors were tested by Haymil the spark given to Unamed took the form of two rings. These paired rings are engraved with small knives and other bladed weapons in an intricate pattern that conceals the true design to anyone but the attuned wearer. As part of the attunement to these rings you must choose weapons to bond with each, once bonded the weapon exists in an extra dimensional space inside the ring, is considered on your person, and can be drawn to your hand a flick of the wrist and are stored by you at will as long as they exist on the same plane.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You also gain the following additonal benefits while attuned:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to your bonded melee weapon strikes damage and to hit.
You gain the Two-Weapon Fighting fighting style.

When you successfully use your sneak attack as part of your attack action, you can make a second sneak attack strike, with your offhand weapon as part of Two-Weapon Fighting, against another target using half the number of Sneak Attack dice for your level (round up).

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Growing in power and reaching its Awakened state the Rings of the Trickster grants these new properties

items: Your bonded melee weapon strikes now gain a +2 bonus to damage and to hit.
Your speed increases by 10 feet.
When you make a melee attack and can normally use your bonus action to make another melee attack via TWF, you can make the extra attack as part of that same Attack action.

item.name: Mote of Knowledge (Awakened)
entries: A Spellshard of endless volume able to hold as much information as one can find, gifted to Jarzamel by Ceritas herself imbued with her Divine energy, given as a reward for the Witchlight Warriors answering her call.

A wizard can use this spellshard as a spellbook, with the usual cost in gold and time to scribe a spell into the shard. You can use an action to open your mind to the shard, seeing its content in your mind. On subsequent rounds, reading the text or scribing new text on blank pages in the shard requires concentration (as if concentrating on a spell) and takes the same amount of time it takes you to read and write normally. Thinking of a particular phrase or topic draws you to the first section in the shard that addresses it.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: You can use the Mote as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it, in addition it has the following properties while in its Dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.
When you prepare wizard spells attuned to the mote the number of spells you can prepare increases by 1.
The Gold cost for Spell Copying is halved while using the Mote as your spellbook.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Growing in power and reaching its Awakened state the Mote of Knowledge grants these new properties:

items: You now gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls, and you can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage of your cantrips.
When you prepare wizard spells attuned to the mote the number of spells you can prepare increases by 2 now.

As a bonus action once per short rest, you prepare a spell of 1st level or higher from your spellbook. This spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it replaces another spell that you had previously prepared.

item.name: Markings of the Wild (Awakened)
entries: Upon the Witchlight Warriors proving their worth to Verdana she gifted Benax a Divine Spark that altered his existing tattoo, enhancing it further.This tattoo when placed in the skin and attuned covers the wearers limbs and body with intricate vine patterns along with the symbol of Verdana appearing on the forehead.

entries.name: Nature's Wrath
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute. For the duration:

items: Each of your melee attacks with a weapon or an unarmed strike can reach a target up to 15 feet away from you, as vines launch toward the target
Your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage on a hit.
Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: It has the following properties while wearing the Markings of the Wild in its Dormant state:

items: Your attacks with monk weapons and unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to non-magical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
Your Constitution Score is raised by 2 to a Maximum of 30.
As a bonus action you can regain Ki points equal to roll of your Martial Arts Die, once per long rest.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Growing in power and reaching its Awakened state the Markings of the Wild grants these new properties:

items: You now gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
Your Constitution Score is raised by 4 now to a Maximum of 30.
When you use Patient Defense or Step of the Wind you can also make an unarmed strike as part of that bonus action.

item.name: Balloon Sword
entries: This item appears to be a sword made out of a balloon, it only allows someone chosen by it to wield it, and the chosen wielder is proficient.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, and it is the only thing able to stop the Jabberwocks regneration trait, and kill it for real.

item.name: Belt of the Elements
entries: The belt was originally worn by the First Elemental Tribunal, Atriaxx and was used in the creation of the Elemental Planes many millennia ago, in 1069 PR it was reassembled by Benax, the current Elemental Tribunal. Ultimately Benax used the reassembled belt to drain the energy from Gorotto's Elemental Gauntlet.

While attuned to the belt, you gain resistance to the channeled Plane's associated damage type: Air (lightning), Earth (thunder), Fire (fire), and Water (cold), and you deal an extra martial arts die of that same type to any target you hit with a melee attack. Whenever you spend 1 or more Ki points, you can choose to shift its planar energy to a different plane of your choice.

item.name: Shield of Throwing
entries: This Shield has a story.

Attuning to this item allows it to be used even while using a weapon with two hands as the shield floats off the bracer used to wear it. Additionally, as a bonus action you can throw the Shield, making a ranged weapon attack (Range 20/60, 1d6 bludgeoning), and it returns to the bracer at start of your next turn giving no AC bonus until then, unless you use your Reaction to catch it on the turn you throw it.

item.name: Dragon's Bane
entries: This longbow is crafted of a lightweight metal shaped by the breaths of the Dragon's that forged it. If you are proficient with {@item shortbow|phb|shortbows} or {@item longbow|phb|longbows}, you are proficient with this bow.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a dragon with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra {@dice 3d6} damage of the weapon's type. For the purpose of this weapon, "dragon" refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns.

item.name: Staff of the Dryad
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

The staff has 5 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff loses its properties and becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

entries.name: Spells
entries: You can use an action to expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell entangle} (1 charge), {@spell pass without trace} (2 charges), {@spell barkskin} (2 charges), {@spell locate animals or plants} (1 charge), {@spell speak with animals} (1 charge), or {@spell speak with plants} (1 charge).
You can also use an action to cast the {@spell druidcraft} spell from the staff without using any charges.

entries.name: Tree Form
entries: You can use an action to plant one end of the staff in fertile earth and expend 1 charge to transform the staff into a healthy tree. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius. The tree appears ordinary but radiates a faint aura of transmutation magic if targeted by {@spell detect magic}. While touching the tree and using another action to speak its command word, you return the staff to its normal form. Any creature in the tree falls when it reverts to a staff.

item.name: Earthmover
entries: This item looks like an ordinary shovel with a 4-foot-long wooden shaft and a blade of iron. When you wield this shovel you can cast the {@spell mold earth|xge} spell at will. Additionally once per day you can cast the {@spell meld into stone} spell.

item.name: Amulet of Supreme Protection
item.reqAttune: by a creature proficient with heavy armor
entries: While wearing this amulet; you gain a +1 to your AC while wearing a paired armor set, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier when the armor is stored inside the amulet, and you can don or doff a set of paired armor as a bonus action. The amulet can be paired to only one set of armor at a time, you pair a set of armor through the process of wearing it while attuning to this empty amulet.

The armor is stored in an extradimensional space inside the amulet, and while there, it is restored and cleaned as if it were a brand new set of armor each time it is summoned. Any spells or effects targeting it (such as heat metal) are removed while stored there. The amulet will store cursed armor, even if the curse would normally prevent its removal. It does not remove the attunement to the armor, nor does it eliminate any cursed effects the armor may carry.

item.name: Irwin's Grapple Gun
entries: Using this gun you can shoot a grappling hook at an object that can support being attached to up to 60 feet away.

item.name: Belt of the Elements, Empty
entries: The belt was originally worn by the First Elemental Tribunal, Atriaxx and was used in the creation of the Elemental Planes many millennia ago, in 1069 PR it was reassembled by Benax, the current Elemental Tribunal.

You can use a reaction when within 30 feet to interrupt the wielder of the Elemental Gauntlet from accessing a stored Elemental Plane's energy within 30 feet of you, the wielder must make a DC 30 CHA Save or lose access to that planes energy as it becomes stored in the Belt of the Elements.

item.name: Curator's Badge
entries: This brooch is emblazoned by a symbol of Ceritas in a fine ornate golden design with a polished blue stone finish to most who see it, but those attuned to any brooches like it see the symbol of the Order of Providence superimposed over the scales with an illusory holographic effect. These badges are used by Curators to learn helpful information about things they encounter in their research, both of the monsters in wilderness and those in civilization they may face getting into danger in pursuit of their goals.

While wearing this brooch, you can use a bonus action to determine any resistance, vulnerability, or immunity to damage of a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see. You do so by making an Intelligence check with a DC of 5 + the CR of the creature, if 1 or greater.
Additionally once per day you can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} and {@spell sending} spells. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

item.name: Staff of Avoidance
entries: This staff is made of magically imbued wood treated by the various breaths of the Dragons that forged it. It can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

The staff has 6 charges for the following properties. It regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff loses its properties and becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

entries.name: Spells
entries: You can expend 1 or more of the staff's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell absorb elements|xge} (1 charge), {@spell shield} (1 charge), {@spell feather fall} (1 charge), {@spell warding wind|xge} (2 charges), {@spell protection from energy} (3 charges), or {@spell counterspell} (3 charges).

item.name: Warhead of Nuclear Winter
entries: This metal ball fits in your hand and is adorned with a yellow and black symbol with the word DANGER under it. You can throw it at a space within 60 feet as an action causing it detonate, destroying itself in the process.

When the Warhead goes off all creatures in a mile radius must succeed on a DC 50 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1000d20} force damage, half on success. The wave continues on initiative 20 expanding a mile each round for a minute, lowering the DC by 5 and halving the intial damage each round after the first. Any objects, inclusing those worn or carried are destroyed on contact unless they are an Artifact. Any area affected by the blast is considered to be under the effect of an {@spell antimagic field} for the next {@damage 10d100} years.

legendaryGroup.name: Elemental Gauntlet
lairActions: The Gauntlet User can activate a Gem on Initiative Count 20, once you use a gem you cannot use it for 2 more rounds.

Magma erupts from a point on the ground the Gauntlet User can see within 120 feet of it, creating a 10-foot-radius, 60-foot-radius geyser. Each creature in the geyser's area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A tremor shakes in a 60-foot radius around the Gauntlet User. Each creature other than the Gauntlet User on the ground in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} as the field changes.

A wave pulses out to a 60-foot radius around the Gauntlet User. Each creature other than the Gauntlet User in that area is pushed back 15 feet and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage.

A gust of wind swirls around the Gauntlet User in a 60 foot radius and moves with them until Initiative 20. For each creature other than the Gauntlet User the area is considered difficult terrain and projectiles automatically miss if they enter the area.
regionalEffects: The skies are marked with scars of the Elemental Planes colliding with the Material, the ground shakes, winds roar, magma erupts in the distance, rain hits your face, the Reckoning has arrived and He needs to be stopped.

legendaryGroup.name: Cerulean Queen
regionalEffects: The region surrounding the Cerulean Keep is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:
- Thunderstorms rage within 6 miles of the lair.
- Water Elementals patrol the seas attempting to sink any vessels chosen by the Cerulean Queen
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

- Static Arc. Lightning arcs, forming a 5-foot-wide line between two of the lair's solid surfaces that the dragon can see. They must be within 120 feet of the dragon and 120 feet of each other. Each creature in that line must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage.

- Sudden Wind. The dragon chooses a point on the ground that it can see within 120 feet of it. A 5-foot-radius cyclone forms centered on that point. A creature in the space must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is thrashed in the whirlwind as it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and lands prone. On a successful save, the whirlwind dissipates.

- Discharged Flash. Ligntning bursts in the air affecting a 10 foot radius within 120 feet of the dragon. A creature in the space must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded} for a minute repeating the save at the end of each of its turns.

spell.name: Mellburt's Tower

components.m: a fragment of stone, wood, or other building material

entries: You conjure a two-story tower made of the material used as a component for the spell. The tower can be round or square in shape. Each level of the tower is 10 feet tall and has a radius of 20 feet. The front door has a lock with key that uses your spellcasting DC, as do all other locks conjured by this spell. Access between levels consists of a spiral staircase. Each level takes one of the following forms, chosen by you when you cast the spell:

items: A master bedroom with a luxurious bed, couch, chest, study desk, and magical fireplace
A barracks style room with 8 single beds and dressers for storage.
A workshop with an alchemical (or other artisan station) station, fully stocked bookshelves of basic texts the caster has read, parchments, ink, and ink pens
A dining space with a kitchen, dining table, chairs, and magical fireplace.
A lounge with couches, armchairs, card table, and magical fireplace.
A spa with toilets, washtubs, a magical steam brazier, and sauna benches
An observatory with a telescope and maps of the night sky.
A dungeon with 4 locking cells, of which you have the keys (this can be an underground level if desired).
An open rooftop (this must be the top level).
An unfurnished, empty room.

entries: The interior of the tower is warm and dry, regardless of conditions outside. Any equipment or furnishings conjured with the tower dissipate into smoke if removed from it. At the end of the spell's duration, all creatures and objects within the tower that were not created by the spell appear safely outside on the ground, and all traces of the tower and its furnishings disappear.

You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the tower's existence for another 24 hours. You can create a permanent tower by casting this spell in the same location and with the same configuration every day for one year.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the tower can have one additional story for each slot level beyond 3rd.
